column1: The aim of this module is to provide basic knowledge on human embryology from fertilization through birth. It includes:1. The mammalian reproductive system2. Gametogenesis3. Fertilisation and Early embryogenesis4. Embryonic Development of special systems5. Congenital malformations

This course allows students to have a highly advanced theoretical and practical understanding of human embryology. It helps student to understand more the applied aspects of clinical embryology. And, it help students to have a comprehensive overview of all aspects of the ART Laboratory, including the set-up and running of the laboratory, specific procedures, and quality control to ensure the highest possible success rates in an IVF program

This course provides a knowledge set appropriate for the broad range of health care professionals involved in the treatment of the infertile male, provide training in the assessement of parameters of male reproductive function, and assist professionals in identifying strategies for the treatment of male infertility. The course includes:1. The physiology and pathophysiology of male reproductive function2. Key elements of the male factor evaluation3. Basic and advanced testing of reproductive function4. Surgical and nonsurgical treatments of male infertility5. Strategies for male fertility preservation

ART diagnosis2. ART treatment3. ART technology4. The latest guidelines and opinions in the ART world5. The latest regulation and law in the ART world6. The latest opinion regarding ART Ethics Assessment: Debate

This course allows students to gain an understanding of the complex issues of infertility, modern fertility treatment, as well as current management strategies for infertile couples. It includes:1. Definition and diagnosis of infertility2. Treatment strategies of infertility3. Patient support and counselling

The course will introduce the students how to select the suitable equipment according to the need of their laboratories, the maintenance and the related regulations. The equipment includes microscope and micromanipulation system, incubators, CASA and vitrification system. Hands-on workshop will be provided to the students during the lesson.

The course will include lectures and discussions on basic science and techniques relating to Human Reproductive Biology. In addition, full ESHRE (European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology) Embryology exam syllabus will be covered.

Reproductive genetics is an increasing part of the assisted reproductive technology (ART) practice. Daily, ART centers use genetic information when couples undergo ethnicity screening, when donors are screened and chosen for recipient couples, to determine the cause of infertility or recurrent pregnancy loss, and when utilizing preimplantation genetic screening (PGS) and preimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD). However, the application of genetic information and genetic testing is often limited due to lack of knowledge by the medical providers in the ART practice. This course serves to provide basic to complex genetic information to help such practices start to fill this education gap and competently apply genetic information to improve patient care. It includes:1. Both basic genetics education and review of real time application. 2. The faculty will address current knowledge of the genetic causes of infertility 3. The latest research on and testing for infertility treatment and diagnosis4. The gamete donor and gestation carrier screening5. The PGD in clinical application6. The latest information about PGS7. The latest technology and its applications

This course allows students to gain an overall picture of ART, including basic conception, definition, basic clinical procedure, basic lab procedure, as well as the most updated knowledge and technology. It includes:1. The development of ART history2. The components of ART team 3. The basic procedures and responsibility of each ART components4. Communication of each components5. Definition and diagnosis of infertility6. Treatment strategies of infertility7. Patient support and counsellingAssessment: written examination

This course allows students to gain detail knowledge and basic information about the modern ART treatment, infertility complex issues, as well as current management strategies for infertile patients.It includes:1. Investigation of infertility 2. Treatment strategies of infertility3. Ovulation induction4. In vitro fertilization in a clinical IVF lab5. Complications of ART (e.g. ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome)6. Counseling of infertile complex issues 7. Patient support

The aim of this module is to quickly review the reproductive medicine related basic knowledge of cell biology and molecular biology, as well as the most update related knowledge. It includes:1. The cell structure and cell organelles2. The cell physiological properties 3. The cell metabolic processes and signaling pathway4. The cell cycles5. The structure and function of DNA, RNA and protein6. The processes of replication, transcription and translation7. The techniques of molecular biology8. The interactions between cell and their environment Assessment: written examination

This course serves to provide basic knowledge and skills on IVF laboratory management, and the communication both inside and outside of the laboratory.It includes:1. IVF lab procedure management 2. IVF lab quality control and risk management3. IVF lab trouble shooting4. Communication inside of the lab5. Communication outside of the lab Assessment: written examination

This course facilitates students to use statistics to carry out their research projects adequately. It includes: 1. Basic research methodology2. Basic statistical concepts3. Research process and encourages an appreciation of why and how research is generatedAssessment: Written Examination

This course gives students a chance to understand very basic requirement of designing a modern IVF laboratory. It includes:1. The basic conception of “clean room”2. The basic requirement of IVF lab designing3. The trend of IVF lab design Assessment: design an IVF lab

Research topics related to reproductive medicine and clinical embryology will be provided. The students are required to perform research work related to thesis topic under direction of their assigned supervisors, who are the principal investigators and senior academic staffs from the Chinese University of Hong Kong.The research project will either be a laboratory-based or clinical data-based investigation. Students are required to write up the result in a dissertation.
